newsitem.title: POLAND: Kety to invest PLN 50 mln this year.
newsitem.headline: Kety to invest PLN 50 mln this year.

text.p: Polish aluminium plant Zaklady Metali Lekkich Kety SA (Kety) plans to invest 50 million zlotys this year, including 30 million zlotys for a new aluminium can production line, the firm's development director said.

"The 30 million comes from our (December) share issue and the rest from last year's profits," Jacek Chwistek told Reuters, adding that the firm planned to invest 15 million to 20 million zlotys from profits each year from 1997 to 2000.
Kety had a net profit of 23.8 million zlotys last year against 7.3 million zlotys in 1994. To the end of July this year it earned 17.9 million zlotys.
Last December investors almost fully subscribed a 417,000-share issue at 70 zlotys a share.

Chwistek said the production line, the first of its kind in Poland, was environmentally friendly and would cut costs. He said the 20 million zlotys from profits would go toward improving the firm's production capabilities in food packaging.
